intro: Scrophularia canescens, commonly known as hoary scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, gray-green stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Scrophularia canescens is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
